description.narrative: Sida stödjer det givargemensamma programmet "Women and Girls First, 2015-2018". Programmet leds av UNFPA och fokuserar på kvinnors sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter samt skydd och tillhandahållande av service för kvinnor som utsatts för våld. Programmet tar sin utgångspunkt i en konflikt med en humanitär kris som följd men bygger samtidigt mer långsiktiga strukturer och system. Programmet implementeras i Kachin, Rakhine och i norra Shanstaten där konflikt pågått under en lång tid.

Sida supports the joint donor programme Women and Girls First Programme 2015-2018. The programme is led by UNFPA and focuses on women’s and girls’ sexual and reproductive health and rights, as well as the protection and provision of services for women who have been subjected to violence. The programme takes its starting point in conflict and humanitarian crises however with a more long-term approach of systems strengthening and sustainable structures. The programme is being implemented in Kachin, Rakhine, and northern Shan state where protracted conflict is present.

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

3.7 - By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programmes.

3.7 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla har tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsovård, inklusive familjeplanering, information och utbildning, och att reproduktiv hälsa integreras i nationella strategier och program.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

5.6 - Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.

5.6 - Säkerställa allmän tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och reproduktiva rättigheter i enlighet med överenskommelserna i handlingsprogrammet från den internationella konferensen om befolkning och utveckling, Pekingplattformen samt slutdokumenten från respektive översynskonferenser.

description.narrative: The process of working integrated with SRHR and GBV, as well as bridging the humanitarian to a more long term, development is now on the right track. One of the key policies against which UNFPA are reporting to demonstrate progress in achieving women’s human rights is the development of national Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in collaboration with the Ministry of Social Welfare, Relief and Resettlement (MoSWRR). These SOPs are not only in line with the priority actions under the National Strategic Plan for the Advancement of Women 2013 – 2022 (NSPAW) but are reflected as a key outcome required under the global Essential Services Package for Women and Girls Subject to Violence (2015, UNDP, UNFPA, UNODC, UNWOMEN, WHO) and affirmed as part of the Action Plan for the Violence Against Women Technical Working Group (VAW TWG). Progress was made in 2017 in establishing the coordination mechanisms led by the Department of Social Welfare to support the operationalization of the NSPAW. UNFPA are supporting the provision of GBV and SRHR services through stationary clinics, mobile services and a One Stop Service Centre. Since the start of the WGF programme 204,340 women and girls were reached with SRH and GBV services and information, of which 99,505 in 2017. It must be noted that this indicator is cumulative. It should also be noted that some beneficiaries are counted more than once, as they may benefit from multiple types of services. A total of 10,804 Dignity Kits were distributed to IDP women and girls in Kachin, Northern Shan, Rakhine in 2017.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
